 Arrivals able to prove they have been fully vaccinated will be tested at the airport on arrival. If the test is negative they will not be required to quarantine. If the test is positive they will be required to quarantine and follow the guidelines set out by the health officials upon entry. International Restrictions:
*All travellers: All travel to or from Montserrat is via Antigua. If you are travelling to Montserrat you must comply with Antiguan entry requirements, even when immediately transiting on to Montserrat.
You can enter Montserrat with a negative COVID-19 test. This can be either a PCR test or rapid antigen test, taken within three days of arrival. On arrival, you will be tested again and if negative, allowed to enter without quarantine. If the test is positive you will be required to quarantine and follow the guidelines set out by the health officials.
Further information, including on the costs of mandatory tests can be found on the Montserrat government website. *If you’re fully vaccinated: You can use the COVID Pass to demonstrate your vaccination record when entering Montserrat.
*If you are not fully vaccinated, or unable to prove you have been fully vaccinated, you will require a negative COVID-19 test. This can be either a PCR test or rapid antigen test, taken within three days of arrival. You will be tested on arrival, and will be required to quarantine for 10 days, adhering to the guidelines and further testing, as set out by the health officials.
Further information, including on the costs of mandatory tests can be found on the Montserrat government website. *Children and young people: Children under the age of two are exempt from pre-arrival testing. Otherwise, children and young people under 18 will be treated the same as the adult who accompanies them.
Further information, including on the costs of mandatory tests can be found on the Montserrat government website.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Montserrat: There are currently no restrictions on internal travel in Montserrat, although social distancing requirements have reduced the capacity on buses and taxis. The wearing of a face covering is mandatory in all publicly accessible buildings, including banks, shops, and government offices etc, and remains mandatory on public transport and planes.
*Accommodation: When planning your visit ensure that you have access to accommodation, either with friends or family or have confirmed the rental of a villa or quarantine-approved guest house, upon arrival.
*Public places and spaces: Most businesses are open as normal, although all must adhere to social distancing rules and wear a face covering, except when eating and drinking in restaurants and bars. There are no longer any restrictions on the number of people allowed to gather in public places. Shops, restaurants and bars are allowed to open as normal. Visit the government of Montserrat’s website for more information.
